title.value: UNRAVELING THE IMPACT OF GENOMIC VARIATIONS ON COGNITIVE ABILITY ACROSS THE HUMAN CORTEX: INSIGHTS FROM GENE EXPRESSION AND COPY NUMBER VARIANTS
title.justification: The title of the specific paper section provided in the text is focused on genomic variations and their impact on cognitive ability, particularly in relation to gene expression and CNVs.
title.quote:
W56. UNRAVELING THE IMPACT OF GENOMIC VARIA-
TIONS ON COGNITIVE ABILITY ACROSS THE HUMAN
CORTEX: INSIGHTS FROM GENE EXPRESSION AND COPY
NUMBER VARIANTS

extractions.description: This research paper explores the effects of genomic variations, specifically copy number variants (CNVs), on cognitive abilities across the human cortex. It analyzes the relationship between CNVs and gene expression changes in different cortical regions and their impact on cognitive function.

type.justification: The paper involves the empirical analysis of cognitive abilities and CNV data across a large number of individuals, using statistical methods such as linear models and enrichment analyses.
type.quote:
Methods: To achieve this, we analyzed measures of cogni-
tive abilities and CNV calls ( > 50 kilobases) in over 259,000
individuals from unselected populations (CARTaGEN, Gen-
eration Scotland, IMAGEN, Lothian Birth Cohort, Saguenay
Youth Study, and UK Biobank).

name.justification: The paper is primarily concerned with understanding cognitive ability and its genetic influence across the cortex, which falls under the field of neuroscience.
name.quote:
Background: Relating behavior to inter-individual genetic
variation and changes in transcription across the cortex re-
mains a key question in neuroscience.

name.justification: The study extensively analyzes genomic variations, specifically CNVs, and their impact on cognitive abilities, indicating the paper's contribution to genomics as a sub-field.
name.quote:
Genomic deletions and duplications - copy number variants (CNVs) - increase
the risk for psychiatric conditions and decrease cognitive ability in the general population.

name.justification: The focus on cognitive abilities and their variation due to genetic factors links this research to cognitive science.
name.quote:
We aim to map the effects of CNVs on cognitive ability across
the human cortex.

name.justification: CARTaGEN is explicitly mentioned as one of the datasets used for analyzing cognitive abilities and CNV calls.
name.quote:
in over 259,000 individuals from unselected populations (CARTaGEN, Gen-
eration Scotland, IMAGEN, Lothian Birth Cohort, Saguenay
Youth Study, and UK Biobank).

name.justification: The Allen Human Brain Atlas is used in the study to assign genes to cortical regions based on their expression patterns.
name.quote:
assigned 16,000 coding genes to 180 cortical brain regions of the Glasser parcella-
tion based on their preferential expression across the hu-
man cortex of healthy adults provided by the Allen Human
Brain Atlas (AHBA);
